brief_description: Our goal is to carry out case/control association analyses for Multiple Sclerosis using our high resolution NGS HLA and MALDI-TOF KIR genotyping methods.
condition_studied: Autoimmune diseases, HLA-associated diseases, KIR-associated diseases, Multiple Sclereosis
description: The association of specific alleles and haplotypes at the HLA class I and class II loci with a variety of autoimmune diseases is well established. Recently, polymorphisms in the Killer Immunoglobulin-like Receptors (KIR) genes that encode the stimulatory and inhibitory receptors on NK cells have been reported to be associated with a few of the same HLA-associated diseases, (e.g. psoriatic arthritis, scleroderma, and T1D). The ligands recognized by many of these receptors are epitopes on HLA class I molecules.  In this study, we examine the role of HLA and KIR alleles, haplotypes, and KIR gene-HLA ligand pairs with a clinically well-defined Multiple Sclerosis cohort and ethnically matched controls using our Roche 454 GS FLX sequencing system for allelic resolution typing of HLA and our high-throughput MALDI-TOF KIR genotyping assay.
endpoints: 1. High-resolution NGS HLA class I and II genotyping. 2. High throughput MALDI-TOF KIR genotyoping. 3. Case-Contol analyses of HLA, KIR and KIR-HLA ligand polymophism.
hypothesis: Polymorphisms at the HLA and KIR loci, and interactions between KIR and their HLA class I ligands are associated with Multiple Sclerosis.
objectives: Peform high-resolution next-generation sequencing (NGS) genotyping of the classical Human Leukocyte Antigen (HLA) loci (HLA-A, -B -C, -DRB1, -DQA1, -DQB1 and -DPB1), and high-throughput MALDI-TOF genotyping of the Killer-cell Immunoglobulin-like Receptor (KIR) loci.  Perform case/control association analyses for Multiple Sclerosis (MS) using these high resolution HLA an KIR genotyping data using BIGDAWG (Bridging ImmunoGenomic Data-Analysis Workflow Gaps) software at multiple levels of polymorphism (genotype, allele, haplotype, amino-acid) and via stratification. Test previous hypotheses regaring MS associations with HLA and KIR polymorphism, and KIR-HLA ligand combinations. Identify specific HLA allele, haplotype, genotype and amino-acid polymorphisms, KIR polymorphisms and haplotypes, and KIR-HLA ligand combinations that display significant predisposing and protective associations with MS.
official_title: The Role of KIR and HLA in Multiple Sclerosis
